title: Morowali Smelter Blast; PT IMIP Workers Urge Company to Improve OHS System - News En.tempo.co
text: Morowali Smelter Blast; PT IMIP Workers Urge Company to Improve OHS System Translator Editor 28 December 2023 08:06 WIB TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The head of the labor union of IMIP Hendri said that the compensation given to the victims of the [smelter](https://www.tempo.co/search?waktu=&kanal=&subkanal=&domain=2&q=smelter) fire is not an adequate remedy for the situation. "Don't let the compensation for the victims lead IMIP to neglect its main obligation to improve the occupational health and safety (OHS or locally K3) system to protect workers," Hendri said in a written statement received by Tempo on Wednesday, Dec. 27. Workers' safety must be the number one priority, Hendri said. "A repeat of this tragedy must not occur just because of IMIP's desire for production," he added. It was previously reported that the incident happened on Sunday of a smelter furnace owned by PT Indonesia Tsingshan Stainless Steel (ITSS) in Morowali that killed 18 workers. PT IMIP then delivered Rp600 million to compensate for the death of its workers, including school tuition for two of the worker's children. Meanwhile, the Media Relations Head of PT IMIP Dedy Kurniawan said non-fatality victims are to be given compensation in each case. Hendri said that compensation was indeed one of the workers' demands. He also hopes that those injured in the incident will be guaranteed financial aid for treatment. "Additionally, workers must be compensated and their wages paid and they could resume working [at PT IMIP] post-recovery," he said. However, workers also have several other demands, such as periodic revitalization, improvement of health facilities, provision of ambulances at IMIP, and quality OHS officers, as well as erasure of the ferroalloy department. "We also demand the policy that allows inter-department lending of workers to be canceled and a commemoration of the incident every 24th of December," he concluded. title: Messi eliminado: los mejores memes tras perder ante Vancouver
text:
¡Messiento eliminado! Los memes no tuvieron piedad con la eliminación de Inter Miami en Concachampions
El conjunto de la leyenda argentina consumó un gran fracaso al quedar eliminado en Semifinales ante Vancouver Whitecaps.
El Inter de Miami de Lionel Messi sufrió este miércoles uno de sus golpes más duros al ser eliminados en las Semifinales de la Copa de Campeones de Concacaf con la derrota de 1-3 en casa contra el Vancouver Whitecaps, por lo que los memes no tardaron en llegar.
Los de la Florida llegaban con el marcador en contra tras haber perdido 2-0 en el partido de Ida en Canadá, pero de inmediato ilusionaron a sus seguidores con un gol tempranero cortesía de Jordi Alba, solo para ver una gran remontada del visitante en la segunda mitad.
De esta forma, el conjunto dirigido por Javier Mascherano consumó un gran fracaso, pues trascender en este torneo internacional era uno de sus grandes objetivos del semestre, ya que el año pasado cayeron con Monterrey en Cuartos de Final, ya con Messi en el plantel.
Memes se desatan contra Messi e Inter de Miami tras eliminación
Al ser Lionel Messi una figura tan mediática cuenta con una gran cantidad de detractores, por lo que desde antes del silbatazo final se desataron las burlas en redes sociales contra su equipo y su persona con los tradicionales memes.
El '10' del Inter Miami fue el principal blanco de los trolleos de los aficionados, que esperaban verlo en la Final del torneo de Concacaf, aunque tampoco sus compañeros y el DT Javier Mascherano no salieron bien librados.
Cabe mencionar que este mismo día su acérrimo rival Cristiano Ronaldo quedó fuera de la Champions asiática con el Al Nassr, pero ni esto detuvo a los seguidores de CR7 para destacar lo sucedido con Messi.
A continuación, te presentamos las creaciones más divertidas y originales del internet que dejó la eliminación de Lionel Messi y el Inter de Miami en la Copa de Campeones de la Concacaf.

author: Park Soo-bin
title: Kia, Samsung join hands to make cars smarter - THE INVESTOR
text:
Korea’s leading auto, electronics giants expand partnership with series of collaboration announcements
Kia has partnered with Samsung Electronics to advance the digital experience of the former’s Platform Beyond Vehicle, or PBV, offerings by integrating the latter’s internet of things, or IoT, solutions into the Kia PBVs, the automaker said Thursday.
According to Kia, the two signed a memorandum of understanding during Kia’s 2025 EV Day held in Tarragona, Spain, on Monday to mark the latest collaboration announcement between Korea’s two leading conglomerates -- Hyundai Motor Group and Samsung Group -- after they consecutively unveiled a series of plans to work together in robot-dedicated batteries and smart factories earlier this week.
Under the agreement, Samsung’s business-to-business IoT platform -- SmartThings Pro -- will be applied to Kia PBVs to enable automated connectivity with business spaces. This solution is expected to help business customers integrate and manage IoT-enabled appliances without complex installations, allowing users to set up certain routines based on the destination entered into the vehicle’s infotainment system.
For example, if a bakery owner were to set a wholesale market as her destination in a Kia PBV, the pre-programmed routine would automatically activate an ingredient purchase mode so that the car’s internal cooling system makes sure the purchased food stays fresh during the drive.
After visiting the market, the bakery owner could set her own store as the next destination in the PBV to activate a commute mode that turns on the air conditioning, signage and other equipment in the store while producing a to-do list as the system checks the inventory.
While on the road after business hours, the bakery owner could also activate a closing mode that ensures devices in the shop are turned off, energy-saving measures are applied and security features are engaged. The system sends real-time notifications to the PBV if unusual activities or system malfunctions are detected.
A guesthouse owner, meanwhile, could activate an unmanned operation mode that enables remote check-in and check-out, unlocks room doors for visitors and controls electronic devices.
“Kia PBVs are designed to be more than just vehicles -- they are intelligent business solutions that connect seamlessly with digital ecosystems,” said Kim Sang-dae, head of Kia’s PBV Division.
"We anticipate that our business collaboration with Samsung, leveraging its AI B2B solution SmartThings Pro, will extend the vehicle user experience for our business customers beyond PBVs into the broader IoT ecosystem. This partnership is expected to create new opportunities to bring value to the customer."
On top of the examples already mentioned, the collaboration between Kia and Samsung is expected to yield other IoT solutions specifically customized to the needs of PBV drivers across a range of industries in global markets.
"By integrating SmartThings Pro into Kia PBVs, we plan to present an intelligent new way for businesses to connect to their customers," said Park Chan-woo, executive vice president of the B2B Integrated Offering Center at Samsung Electronics.
"We will provide an optimized, integrated store management experience based on customized solutions to cater to a range of B2B customers, including the self-employed and small business owners."
During the EV Day event, Kia unveiled the PV5, its first PBV model, along with the latest versions of the EV4 and EV2 concept cars.
By Kan Hyeong-woo (hwkan@heraldcorp.com)

title: 于东来：若员工到手工资不到4000，这个超市可以关了，不要扰乱市场！曾称胖东来员工最低月到手收入超8000元|工资_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
每经编辑 张锦河
据蓝鲸新闻，3月28日，胖东来董事长于东来在接受联商网董事长庞小伟对话时，谈及“调改”与超市行业现状。于东来称，超市行业面临困难需要重新梳理，把不好的产品下架，同时要优化员工的体验。
此外于东来表示，山姆工资太低了，要增长，它如果不涨工资将来还是不好，“我们做企业首先是要让我们的员工幸福，我们才是最好的企业家。”
于东来还提到：“ 如果我们不能保证让员工拿到最起码4000块钱以上的收入，是交完社保以后的，自己的企业就关了就行了 ，你也不要在这扰乱这个市场。然后如果你能让员工拿到4000块钱以上的收入，而且还不赔钱，那你就优化商品，逐步的让自己往更加健康的方向去做。”
图片来源：蓝鲸新闻视频截图 近日，胖东来官网公开了集团在许昌、新乡两地不同业态的人员流失率情况。
统计数据显示，2025年2月胖东来在许昌和新乡两地共流失员工10人，其中许昌流失8人，新乡流失2人， 集团合计离职率为0.12％； 管理人员未有流失。今年前两个月，许昌和新乡两地共流失28人，其中包括管理人员2人。
2025年1~2月，胖东来集团共流失了28人，其中包括2名管理人员及26名员工，人员流失率为0.33%。
1月8日，胖东来创始人于东来在社交平台发文称，2024年胖东来集团整体销售近170亿元，税收6亿多元、利润8亿多元， 其中提到员工平均月收入9000多元。
去年12月13日，于东来在社交平台发文称， 胖东来未来几年要追求实现的目标是每周工作时间36小时以内 ，星期六闭店休息，实现让员工与家人一起享受周末的美好时光；每年40至60天的休假， 员工最低月到手纯收入保持在8000元以上。
业绩方面，2025年1月1日，于东来发布胖东来商贸集团2024年销售数据。数据显示，2024年胖东来商贸集团销售额达169.64亿元，各业态中年销售额最高的是超市，许昌达到59.45亿元，新乡为21.48亿元，单品中茶叶销售额为6.19亿元，15个销售场所中时代广场营业额最高，达到44.13亿元。

title: Everton boss Sean Dyche questions Liverpool call and demands Prem rule change | Football | Sport | Express.co.uk
text:
Dyche criticises penalty laws after Everton lose to Man City
Everton manager Sean Dyche has questioned how Arsenal captain Martin Odegaard's apparent handball against Liverpool wasn't a penalty if Amadou Onana was adjudged guilty of handball in their defeat to Manchester City on Wednesday night. The Toffees felt harshly done by when Julian Alvarez scored a penalty at Goodison Park to make it 2-1 to City.
Trending While the ball clearly struck Onana's hand, Everton felt the midfielder was very close to Nathan Ake when the City defender took his shot on goal and that his hand was not necessarily in an unnatural position. Dyche called the decision for referee John Brooks to the point to the spot "bizarre" post-match.
The call came just days after Liverpool were denied a seemingly blatant penalty for a handball offence from Odegaard against Arsenal at Anfield. PGMOL said that the VAR did not overrule referee Chris Kavanagh because it was "not a clear and obvious error".
They also said the Norwegian's arm moved towards his body and not his ball and that it wasn't a deliberate or unnatural action from the attacking midfielder. Yet it was widely deemed an incorrect call and even Arsenal defender William Saliba reacted: "Of course, it was a penalty. But, I'm not the referee and we have to accept [the decision]."
And Dyche said: "When they [IFAB] come out with these rules, how many active football people, managers, do they speak to? And this can be across the board, it doesn't just have to be the Premier League .
Sean Dyche thinks Liverpool should have had a penalty vs Arsenal (Image: GETTY/SKY SPORTS)
Everton midfielder Amadou Onana conceded a penalty against Man City (Image: GETTY) "They may do that, but I have a feeling they probably don't. If they do, they keep it under wraps because I've never heard of it. Handball is such an odd thing. The one the other day from Odegaard, how's that not a penalty? It's just bizarre.
"And then our one, that's where we're going and how can those two things be that different in their outcome? You can't work it out. That to me is unfathomable and everyone is scratching their head."
The Everton manager has claimed all of the Premier League 's managers want to see the handball rule changed. He boss: "Managers want to see a difference, especially when it's overpowering. The view on handball is overpowering, I don't mind telling you that.
"It's not a secret. We had a Zoom call, all the managers were there and they all said this has got to be changed. Roy Hodgson spoke very clearly, as he does about his feelings on it, and gave a couple of incidents and basically we all said we've no clue. It's a real head-scratcher.
"One week it's given, the next it's not. There wasn't anyone saying 'we're gaining' or 'we're losing', none of that. It was just that it was wrong on every level and all over the place.

Ex-Everton boss Roberto Martinez, now in charge of the Portugal national team, said on broadcaster Amazon Prime: "For me, it is not a penalty at all. For me, football people know that it is not a penalty."
While ex- Premier League ref Mark Clattenburg added: "We're discussing handball for many, many years and we are still no further forward of actually improving it. One week it is given, one week it's not. Is it deliberate or is it not?
"Is the arm outstretched or is it not? Every week we are debating it and the referees are just trying to apply the Laws of the Game. If the referee didn't give that penalty, he would be criticised.
"He has given it and is criticised. The law needs changing and it needs the coaches, players and referees to get round and try to find a better way to understand handball."

title: Life Is Chill Expands Line of THC Soft Gels with New Live Resin THC Capsules, A First Of Its Kind for the Arizona Market | News | decaturdailydemocrat.com
text: The new plant-based soft gel will launch on Friday, January 19, providing Arizona consumers with a unique and innovative capsule option. Ally Biotech, dba Life Is Chill, a science-based provider of leading-edge bioactive delivery solutions for cannabinoids, today announces the launch of its live resin soft-gel capsules, ResinTime, under its Life Is Chill product line. The initial offering to the market is vegan-friendly, a new innovative soft gel based on a tapioca-starch and sugar-free product that addresses some of the dietary needs of consumers. The launch of live resin capsules marks a new era for soft gels in the Arizona market and will meet the increasing demand for products made from fresh-frozen cannabis. “Capsules are an increasingly popular choice for those seeking a smoke-free and sugar-free product, but the common practice of using gelatin in pills makes them inaccessible to people who prefer plant-based products or people that have allergies to bovine gelatin,” said Francis Baczek, President at Life Is Chill. “Our newest addition to the Chill Pill product line solves this problem with the additional benefit of high-quality live resin.” The ResinTime soft gels will officially launch on January 19th, 2024, at The Superior Dispensary in Phoenix. The vegan-friendly ResinTime is the company's newest addition to its current portfolio of easy-to-swallow THC soft-gel capsules, which includes six other variations: Day Caps, Night Caps, Anytime Caps, Anytime Hybrid+, Extreme Caps, and THCa Caps. “We are honored to kick off the launch of these live resin soft gels, a first of its kind in the Arizona market,” said Steve Shapiro, founder and CEO of The Superior Dispensary. “As a vegan, I’m excited to have a vegan-friendly product available for consumers. These capsules will provide another great option for customers seeking new ways to consume live resin-based products in an easily digestible way.” The award-winning soft gel brand is available in dozens of dispensaries across the state and has cemented itself as an Arizona staple for almost a decade. With the global cannabis capsule market expected to reach $108.14 billion by 2029, according to Data Bridge Market Research, and at least 6% of the American population identifying as either vegetarian or vegan, this new launch will meet the growing demand for dietary-friendly live resin products and provide an inhalation-free and sugar-free method of consumption for Arizona cannabis users. The new product launch follows Ally Biotech’s acquisition of the Chill Pill line in the spring of 2023. It continues the company’s plan to expand its product line and establish itself as a market leader in the soft gel category. For more information about the Chill Pill, visit Lifeischill.com. About Life Is Chill: The Arizona-based Life Is Chill brand is an expansive line of easy-to-swallow THC soft gels for the cannabis industry. Formulated using hemp seed oil, Chill Pills are sugar-free, easy to absorb and metabolize, and come in various strengths and strains, with effects ranging from highly responsive to highly relaxed. Life Is Chill is owned and operated by Ally Biotech, a company committed to harnessing the power of science to create innovative THC products. For more information, visit Lifeischill.com . The company’s Lipofusion® delivery technology combines nanotechnology and liposomal science to speed product differentiation and innovation.
